result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward E Flournoy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward E Flournoy not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt Ricci appeared by video for Edward E Flournoy.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and has not came to resolution at this time.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 by zoom.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward E Flournoy in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Edward E Flournoy in custody at MSDF.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward E Flournoy appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Defendant Edward E Flournoy in court, appear by video in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request a State V-Lee hearing. Court Denied request. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Time for the preliminary hearing set 7/27/2022 has been changed from 10am to 9am due to video availability of MSDF.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Chunlei C.; Don Jacobs Toyota, Heiser Automotive Group, Hyundai West Allis, Russ Darrow Nissan, Schlossman Honda City, Genevieve G.S.; Jacob R.B.; Symone C.; & Christopher R.T.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Edward E Flournoy in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Edward E Flournoy in custody at MSDF.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward E Flournoy appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
